fields.summary: Ability to wrap text in a table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31172].
  {panel}

Currently, the binary installers follows symbolic links when searching for "changed" content under the Confluence (or JIRA) Installation Directory.

Eg, I have all my personal images linked under the /opt/confluence/confluence/images folder - so the binary installer thinks a bunch of files has been added. 

For JIRA, a lot of customized gif's are linked in.

Worst case, ignoring this and taking a backup via the installer gives a rather big zip file.

So if the installer could either ignore or present a dialog box regarding ignoring (choosing) symlink, that would be excellent.
fields.summary: Ignore or choose how to handle symlinks in the binary installer
Would like to add Insert HTML and SharpView Plug in as static item on Insert Menu in Edit Screen
As a User, I want an In-App notification when content is shared to a group that I am a member of

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31160].
  {panel}

Currently, Confluence leaves the username field filled in after a failed login attempt, but still places the cursor in this field. If a user is not paying attention, they risk typing their password in plain text where the user ID should go. 

Alternative solutions include:
* Not placing the cursor in either of the input fields. (Facebook's approach)
* Clearing out the username field as well. (WordPress's approach)
fields.summary: When re-entering user details after a failed login, the cursor should be placed in the password field rather than the username field
Upgrade Adaptavist Content Formatting Macros add-on to the latest version
User name should be masked in the HTML source code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31153].
  {panel}

The Clickable Macro is broken in Confluence 5.3 when using Chrome.  

There are two problems:
1.  Clicking on the image will bring the image to the center of the screen initially, before redirecting you to the page intended after a second or so.  Sometimes it does not redirect you at all, and you only get the zoomed in image.
2.  If you edit the macro to go directly to the page URL, you get a red X in the macro - it appears URLS do not work at all.

Steps to reproduce 1: 
1. Insert the Clickable Macro, pointing it to a space or page
2. After inserted, add an image
3. Save
4. Click on the image 
After doing this, the image will be brought to the center of the screen. After a few seconds, you may be directed to the page intended.  But I also have an example of never being redirected. 

Steps to reproduce #2:
1. Edit the macro you made before
2. Insert a direct link the page instead of the auto filled page
3. Save the macro
You'll see a red box.
fields.summary: Adaptavist Clickable Macro is broken in Chrome
Remove the src=email from the url in the browser (e.g. browser pushstate)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31145].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Anchor links on mobile devices are not working correctly.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence
 * Mobile device iOs or Android, any browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 pages named "Page A" and "Page B"
 # Page A has this content (if inserted in Wiki Markup):
{code:java}
h3.Subsection
h3.Subsubsection
{code}

 # Page B links to Page A's Subsection and Subsubsection anchors:
{code:java}
[Page A#Subsubsection]







[Page A#Subsection]
{code}

 # On the mobile devices click on Page A#Subsubsection

h3. Expected Results

It should take you to: Page A ,Subsubsection
h3. Actual Results

It takes you to the top of the page

h3. Notes
 On the desktop browser, the redirection link is http://<hostname:port>/display/<id>/Page+A#PageA-Subsubsection
 On the mobile phone browser, the redirection link is http://<hostname:port>/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=65621#content/view/65613
fields.summary: Anchor links on mobile device don't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31143].
  {panel}

As an admin, it may be necessary to set a user avatar. This could be to remove an inappropriate one, or to set a standard one our org uses. Ideally, this functionality would be exposed via the REST API so user creation can be further automated. 
* Sub feature is to "lock" an avatar and not allow it to be edited by a user.
* Sub feature is to allow editing of multiple user's avatars at once

Current ability to accomplish this happens in one of 2 ways:

1. Use a third party plugin to allow me to SU to a user. Then modify it while logged in as them
2. Change the users password, log in as them, make the change. In the event of an LDAP infrastructure, this means locking them out of multiple systems.
fields.summary: Allow admins to edit user avatars
Confluence page watchers should be notified when a task that is listed in a JIRA Issue macro is updated in JIRA
Don't start Confluence automatically after an upgrade

http://www.brynosaurus.com/cachedir/

That way when we do a file system level backup we are automatically able to exclude certain cache/temporary index folders.

(I've raised this against confluence, but the request applies to all project.)
fields.summary: Implement Cache Directory Tagging

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31124].
  {panel}

With the great introduction of sections in Confluence, it would be great to have the PDF have page-breaks before each section.

The current implementation does not seem to have a strategy for page breaks, and I thing using sections is a very good idea.

A possible fallback could be to use headers to have pages not break right after a header, for example.

This would really enhance the possibility to use the PDF:s and not having to save a PDF from the print dialog in Mac.
fields.summary: PDF export layout with page breaks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31123].
  {panel}

When the 'Threaded Comments' option is disabled on Confluence General Configuration, emails are still sent using the same template with the 'Reply' option.
for example:
http://<instance-name>wiki/display/space/page?replyToComment=6324225#comment-6324225

That page will not allow you to add a Reply or Comment.
!reply_no_threads.jpeg|thumbnail!

Removing the '?replyToComment=6324225#comment-6324225' part of the url will display the Add Comment box as expected.
!reply_expected.jpeg|thumbnail!

*How to Reproduce:*
# Disable 'Threaded Comments'
# Comment on a page
# upon reception of the email, click on Reply

*Ideas:*
Since there is no Threads, then the Reply button can be changed to 'Comment' (along with modifying the link) or removed.
fields.summary: Disabling Threaded Comments should permeate to emails also
Need Bold Colors in Highlight Table Selection in Pages
Restrict some users or groups so they can't see all other confluence users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31117].
  {panel}

Is it possible to add a drop down list to the *Insert Link* dialog box that allows the user to define whether a link opens:
* On the Current Page (default)
* In a New Tab
* In a New Window

There are many requests for this type of functionality on the Atlassian sites and, even though this feature can be realized by implementing User Macros, it would be nice to have it as a built-in feature for On Demand and On Premises versions of Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence Hyperlink Opens in a New Tab or a New Window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31115].
  {panel}

I'd like users to be able to create a list of reserved labels that only they can use to tag/label content within the system. This will create predictability and ensure that undesired content doesn't sneak into critical pages.

*Use case:*
Create dynamic pages leveraging labels, but give control to users over what content is aggregated to the page eliminating worry about whether someone else might use their labels on other pages.

It's simple enough to create a monstrosity of a label which is less likely to be used by others, but you still run the risk of rogue content sneaking in if another user uses that label on one of their pages unbeknownst to the user who created the content.

Having reserved labels also creates predictability when using labels in other applications/addons or programmatically.
fields.summary: Reserved Labels
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/confluence/content/ContentEntityAdapterParent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31088].
  {panel}

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page.
# Click Tools >> Attachment 
# Click {{Choose File}} button
# Attach file with the name 'İ ' ( use the İ.txt attached in this ticket)
# The following error will appear in the browser and the atlassian-confluence.log file.
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.beans.AttachmentStorer.attachFiles(AttachmentStorer.java:64)
Stack Trace:[hide]

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.beans.AttachmentStorer.attachFiles(AttachmentStorer.java:64)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.AbstractViewAttachmentsAction.execute(AbstractViewAttachmentsAction.java:104)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
at 
{code}

h3. *Workaround*
(i) Applicable for other non-latin languages except for {{İ}} Turkish character
# Ensure your database collation settings are able to handle international strings. 
Refer to this [comment for a PostgreSQL fix|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31088?focusedCommentId=852007&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-852007]
# Refer to this [link for more information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-database-character-encoding-177698.html#ConfiguringDatabaseCharacterEncoding-ForPostgreSQLrunningunderLinux]
fields.summary: java.lang.NullPointerException when try to attach file with non-Latin characters

*Feature Request Background*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31065].
  {panel}

When viewing a secure site over SSL, most browsers default behavior blocks or prompts with a warning any linked non-SSL content. The "What's New" iframe can be configured via help-paths.properties to load from https://docs.atlassian.com/ instead of http://docs.atlassian.com/ in an attempt to avoid this. However, that doesn't achieve much since the "What's New" destination page then does a redirect to non-SSL page located under http://www.atlassian.com/ which then attempts to redirect to https://www.atlassian.com/

Because the insecure redirect is blocked, the user gets an empty white box for the "What's New" feature or if they are lucky an error message saying the content couldn't be loaded. Some browsers will prompt the user asking if they would like to permit mixed content, others will not.

It seems clear to me that the redirect setup from https://docs.atlassian.com/ should go straight to the secure https://www.atlassian.com/ site since that's where the content is ultimately hosted anyway.

I don't want to host Confluence help locally and I'm not even sure that would include "What's New" notices anyway. The only feasible workaround I could come up with was to disable "What's New" notices, which is rather unfortunate.

To reproduce, visit the first URL and inspect the HTTP requests with Tamper Data or Fiddler:
https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-52/whatsnew/iframe
http://www.atlassian.com/en/software/confluence/whats-new-iframe/52
https://www.atlassian.com/en/software/confluence/whats-new-iframe/52
fields.summary: "What's New" inconsistent user experience across browsers on SSL wiki site

If you have an existing JIRA OnDemand instance with existing users and you add Confluence OnDemand:

1. Users will not be populated in the people directory
2. Users cannot be @mentioned  

Looks like in both cases, the user will be populated in the people directory and they can be mentioned once the said user authenticates. 

Note: If it helps, Confluence was provisioned about 4 hours before the issue was presented to support. 

We tried manually syncing crowd but it had no effect.
fields.summary: Users Not Populated in People Directory After Adding Confluence OnDemand to Existing JIRA OnDemand

I was trying to test the wikidsmart plugin on our confluence test installation.

The first issue was that the importet wikidsmart spaces were not visible in the space list either on the dashboard or the space list macro. 

After trying to reinstall the wikidsmart plugin I now have the situation that no spaces are listed when viewing the space directory, but they are still listed on the space list widget on the dashboard.

When I click on the wikidsmart space(s) in the space administration section   I get a 404. The other spaces that are not visible in the space directory show up in the space admin section and the permissions can be changed normally.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31026].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 12 October 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
h4. What had caused this issue?
The [JIRA Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] is used to create links to JIRA issues in Confluence pages. These links contain the identification of which JIRA instance the JIRA Issue Macro then will be referring to.
This issue occurred as Confluence A and Confluence B do not have the same Application Links configured. 
JIRA Issue Macros' in Confluence B (imported from Confluence A via Space backup) aren't able to render the issues correctly as it is still referring to JIRA instance configured in Confluence A, in which is not configured in Confluence B.
h4. Resolution for Cloud instances
The Confluence Cloud importer has been updated to provide a *_JIRA macro repair_* feature, in which any broken JIRA macros will be fixed as part of the import.
For more details on this, please refer to our [Import the space content into Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/import-a-confluence-space-724765531.html#ImportaConfluenceSpace-Step3.ImportthespacecontentintoConfluenceCloud] document.
h4. Workaround for Server instances
If you're using Confluence Server and you've recently changed domain name, migrated from Confluence Cloud, or merged multiple instances, you may need to relink JIRA issues macros.
For a workaround of this issue, please refer to the steps outlined in our [How to bulk update JIRA Issue Macro to point to a different JIRA instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+bulk+update+JIRA+Issue+Macro+to+point+to+a+different+JIRA+instance]
{panel}
h3. Summary
Creating a backup of your Confluence Cloud Space to import into another Confluence Cloud instance affects JIRA issue macro with the warning:
{noformat}
"Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration."
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
[Export Space XML backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Export+Content+to+Word%2C+PDF%2C+HTML+and+XML#ExportContenttoWord,PDF,HTMLandXML-ExporttoHTML,XML,orPDF] from Confluence A.
[Import the generated XML backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Import+a+Confluence+Space] to Confluence B.
h3. Expected Results
Contents of the imported Space (JIRA Issue Macro in particular) are rendered successfully.
h3. Actual Results
JIRA Issue Macros that exist in the imported space's pages are not rendered. Instead, the following warnings are shown:
{noformat}
"Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration."
{noformat}
fields.summary: Confluence Space Export/Import Affects JIRA Issue Macro Links
Need to be able to right-justify groups of cells in a table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31021].
  {panel}

When using the Site Importer tool in the latest Confluence OnDemand release (*5.3-OD-7*), all content ownership is set to 'Anonymous'. This can be reproduced when importing a full backup from a standalone Confluence (tested with 5.2.5). Looking into the database, we can see that "creator" and "lastmodifier" are *null* for any imported page.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a backup from a Confluence v.5.2.5 (or use the backup attached)
# Import that backup via *Import Site* menu in a Confluence 5.3-OD-7

h4. Expected results
Page/Blog creators or modifiers are correctly displayed

h4. Actual results
Page/Blog creators or modifiers are shown as *anonymous*
fields.summary: Site Import causes users to show as Anonymous in metadata

  {panel}

Update - Archiving plugin can be used for Standalone Confluecne, but there is no way to archive individual pages in OnDemand without moving them to an archived space.

Hi,

In our organisation we store information on pages by season (Spring Summer 14 ; Autumn Winter 14 etc)...Eventually we will need to archive these pages.

I was thinking of creating a space called 'Archive'. How can I move the pages and their contents there?

Thanks
Amel
fields.summary: Add ability to Archive individual Pages

A macro that displays all permissions on a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30991].
  {panel}

Currently, a regular user can only see the page specific permissions of a page, and can't see space restrictions at all.

It would be good for them to be able to easily and quickly check what their page looks like to either an anonymous user, or a specific user. This will allow users who aren't familiar with how permissions work in Confluence to quickly and easily verify if their page is secure, which is all they really want.

This would also be a good way for admins to make sure if their whole instance is displaying to a certain user as they expect it should.

[Facebook has this feature|https://www.facebook.com/help/288066747875915], for reference.
fields.summary: How does my page/space/instance look to other people?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30990].
  {panel}

Currently, the STP is included with Confluence-only OnDemand, which enables customer admins to submit support requests directly from the application. This is undesirable because:
- it bypasses the usual issue creation process in SAC (which can notify customers about ongoing incidents that affect them before they contact us),
- it puts the issue into the wrong SAC project (delaying our response time),
- it doesn't include logs, because of the way things are set up in OnDemand.

The STP isn't present with JIRA+Confluence OD. It should be the same for Confluence-only OD.
fields.summary: Support Tools Plugin should not be allowed to create issues from Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30984].
  {panel}

Steps
* insert a jira issue macro
* in the settings configure columns to be "Resolution", "Issue Type", "Summary", "Key"
* save the page and notice that the order of the column was changed
fields.summary: The order of columns defined for jira issues macro is not respected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30979].
  {panel}

With the Macro "Page Properties Report" you can define which fields of the Page-Header are displayed in the report. But the ordering is random.

I want to define by which field the report should be ordered default.
(Example: I manage my Milestones with Confluence and I have a Field ID or Startdate. Now I want to have the List default ordered by ID or Startdate to have the right view when I open th page. But it orders by ?!?!?! I don't know by what it orders. Looks random)

Thanks.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report - Default column ordering/sorting
Make the  warning message to upgrade application link to be more visible to system administrators.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30963].
  {panel}

The current display format of a single JIRA issue is not desirable in some cases. 

Specifically, I want to include references to multiple JIRA issues on a Confluence page individually to dictate the order of the issues and possibly include the same issue multiple times in the list. 
I also want to customize what information is shown per issue, but the Display Options are only available when multiple issues are selected. 

My hope is the macro could easily identify if no display options were changed, or a URL was copied onto the page, and then display information the way it does today. It would only be the case where the user explicitly set display options that the macro would render as if there were multiple issues selected.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro - allow Display Options for a single issue, not just multiple
Provide a way create the cluster name from the multicast IP
New Macro that can gather all task list from different pages into a single page
Regular Expressions in Shortcut Links
Allow Cloud customers to upload their own fonts to Confluence for PDF exports
When calling getDisplayableWebPanels for the "atl.dashboard.left" location Confluence does not pass in a context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30945].
  {panel}

Because making me upload files one at a time is just mean.

If you can support multiple on drag-and-drop, why not through the file upload form control? JIRA does it quite well.

Hell, in many instances, the *only* code change required is to add the "multiple" attribute to the form field.

http://screencast.com/t/NWf5T14Ul
fields.summary: Allow multiple file upload through your form fields
"System cannot find the path specified" error thrown when attempting to archive to backups folder
Add the option/ability to index URLs, to allow the URL text to be searched.
Merge Blueprints and Templates
Add ability to disable Space Blueprints as a site admin
Generate Plugin and Macro Report
Improve backup/restore such that it is possible to take a backup within the app prior to upgrading Confluence
The ability to rename a blueprint template
Fix "Share on Confluence" button to have site logo and title in the Shared Links blueprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30924].
  {panel}

Greetings, 

I'm a fan of Bitbucket and Confluence. But, I'm having a problem going back and forth between the two to manage a project that I'm currently working on. Therefore, It would be very helpful if there was an option to integrate the two products together. 

Regards,
Abdulrahman.
fields.summary: Integrate Confluence with BitBucket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30922].
  {panel}

When using the task list macro in OnDemand, Word Export no longer works.

Steps to reproduce: 
- Add the task list macro to any page
- Save
- Try to export the page to word 

Reproduced again in customers instance today (8/10/2013) and also a dev instance on 5.2-OD-13.  

Happening in Chrome & Firefox.
fields.summary: Word Export doesn't work when using the Task List Macro
Limit the visibility of "Request more content" in the create dialog to admins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30916].
  {panel}

From [this|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONFJIRA/Confluence+JIRA+3+Plugin] documentation, the valid columns for the macro are key, summary, type, created, updated, due, assignee, reporter, priority, status and resolution. However, we don't know whether custom field is actually permitted or otherwise.

From a simple test, the result varies for certain type of custom fields.

||Text Field||Multi Select||Radio Buttons||
|success|fail|success|
fields.summary: Permitted columns in JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30911].
  {panel}

Links to child pages (Children Display macro) are broken when exporting personal space to PDF.
Instead of linking to a page in PDF document links are pointing to Confluence (export_personal_space.pdf).
When pages are moved from Personal to Global space links are ok (table_confluence_pdf.pdf).
In attached files links are on page 2 (Page1, Page2ž).
If page title have special characters (Page2ž) link is ok (to document not to internet)
fields.summary: Links to child pages in pdf export of Personal space
Supress "What's New" Dialog Box for Sysadmin Account
Find and Replace for Confluence Editor Fails in IE10
Problem with function "Import from Word document"
API change: extend PermissionDelegate to allow checking whether a user can create within a target

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30902].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Login as administrators in *Confluence only* OnDemand instance
# Go to "Confluence Admin -> Users"
# Click on current username used and then, *Edit Groups*
# Tick on any other group listed to join the group
# Click *Save* and below error will be thrown:
bq. To prevent Confluence being left without any administrators, you cannot remove yourself from the last remaining group(s) that allow you to ADMINISTER or USE confluence. If you wish to revoke your administrator access, have another administrator remove you.

h3. Expected Result:
The error shouldn't be thrown if the admin is not trying to leave administrators group but just join other group.
Administrators should be able to join and leave any other group except administrators group.

h3. Actual Result:
Administrators cannot join or leave any group if they try to edit their own memberships.

h4. Notes:
This only affect Confluence only OnDemand. Not JIRA+Confluence as the user management will be controlled by JIRA.

h4. Workaround:
Atlassian Support can work around this by ticking any other wanted groups *plus* system-administrators group. Save it.

Even though there will an error thrown about joining sysadmin group, the other ticks will be save correctly. Triggering different error seems to get the bug ignored.
fields.summary: Administrators cannot control their own group memberships
Make Captcha configurable based on X-Forwarded-For header
Linux/Unix installer backup should create backup file using archive format which preserve the file permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30892].
  {panel}

Go to.. Apache HIVE Getting Started Documentation

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/GettingStarted

Under Section ...

Simple Example Use Cases
MovieLens User Ratings

wget http://www.grouplens.org/system/files/ml-data.tar+0.gz

The link mentioned as per the document does not work. It needs to be updated to the below URL.

http://www.grouplens.org/sites/www.grouplens.org/external_files/data/ml-data.tar.gz

I am setting this defect's priority as a Blocker because, user's will not be able to continue their hands on exercises, unless they find the correct URL to download the mentioned file. 

Referenced from:
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hive-user/201302.mbox/%3C8A0C145B-4DB9-4D26-8613-8CA1BD741B49@daum.net%3E.
fields.summary: Link doesn't work. Needs to be updated as mentioned in the Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30891].
  {panel}

Bug present in JIRA Issues macro v5.1.

When inserting a JIRA issue into a Confluence page using wiki-markup, no remote link is created to JIRA.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an applink to a JIRA instance
2. Create an issue in JIRA, e.g. TP-1
3. Edit a Confluence page and insert the issue using wiki-markup, e.g. {jira:TP-1}
4. Save the page and check that the macro renders correctly (it should)
5. Check the JIRA issue for linked pages (there will be no linked pages)

This behaviour is inconsistent with what happens when the issue is inserted via the JIRA Issues macro dialog, which properly creates a remote link to JIRA.
fields.summary: Inserting a JIRA issue macro via wiki-markup doesn't create a remote link to JIRA
Allow gmail to be configured in Confluence as it is in Jira
